body_text:
Since the system add-on has shipped, we are receiving a lot of expected 301s, due to #719. (#719 is fixed in master, but not shipped yet)
We are also getting some unexpected and unexplained 301s. There are a couple weird things here:

We occasionally get about 3x the amount of 301s for an hour.
We are gettings 301s on self-repair.mozilla.org, which isn't supposed to get add-on traffic.
We get small bumps in 301s on the hour every hour.

Current theories are that there are organizations that start up a bunch of Firefox instances for automation on a cron job, or that there is something in Firefox's update timer that causes it to cluster around certain times.
Graph of 301s on self-repair.mozilla.org (blue) and normandy.cdn.mozilla.net (purple) over a 24 hour period

This issue covers figuring out what is going on here, and if it is reasonable, fixing it.
CC @relud
